articles.author: By Maureen Chowdhury, Elise Hammond, Aditi Sangal and Adrienne Vogt, CNN
articles.title: Live updates: Attorney General Merrick Garland to deliver remarks
articles.description: Attorney General Merrick Garland is set to deliver a statement at the Department of Justice in Washington, DC. Follow live news updates.
articles.content:
Attorney General Merrick Garland will make a statement at 2:30 p.m. ET at the Department of Justice.
The topic of the statement was not given.

articles.title: 'Not funny to me': O'Rourke curses at heckler over guns - CNN Video
articles.description: CNN's John Avlon and Errol Lewis discuss Texas gubernatorial candidate Beto O'Rourke cursing at a heckler over guns at a campaign event.

articles.author: Jeremy Diamond, Arlette Saenz
articles.title: Biden to stay 'laser focused' on legislative accomplishments amid Trump investigations
articles.description: President Joe Biden doesn't plan to allow the investigations into his predecessor to muddy his efforts to tout a recent string of legislative achievements ahead of the midterm elections.
articles.content:

articles.title: Feds seized documents from Mar-a-Lago in June with grand jury subpoena
articles.description: The FBI search at Mar-a-Lago this week came months after federal investigators served an earlier grand jury subpoena and took away sensitive national security documents from former President Donald Trump's property during a June meeting, people familiar with …

articles.title: Video: What Michael Cohen thinks Trump fears the most about the FBI search of Mar-a-Lago - CNN Video
articles.description: Michael Cohen, who was Donald Trump's personal attorney for almost a decade, says that Trump feels trapped because if an informant has tipped off the FBI, that person probably has more incriminating information.

articles.title: Wall Street Journal: Informant tipped off investigators about more documents at Mar-a-Lago
articles.description: The FBI search of former President Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago residence on Monday was prompted by a tip to investigators about the possibility of additional classified documents at the Palm Beach club, according to a Wall Street Journal report.
